TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE ( GPE ) . He is represented before the ORG by Mr J. Groen , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

Together with his mother and brother , the applicant moved from GPE to the GPE in DATE where they joined the applicant ’s father , who was living there since DATE and who died in DATE . In DATE , after the death of his brother , the applicant married – obliged by NORP tradition – his brother PERSON widow . After the latter ’s expulsion from the GPE in DATE , the applicant divorced her . In the meantime , the applicant had started a relationship with PERSON , a NORP national . CARDINAL children , PERSON and PERSON , were born out of this relationship on DATE and CARDINAL DATE , respectively . On DATE the applicant was granted a permanent residence permit ( vergunning tot vestiging ) .

On DATE , the applicant was driving a getaway car after an armed robbery . During the car ’s pursuit by the police CARDINAL of the persons in the car driven by the applicant shot and killed a policeman . On DATE , ORG ( ORG ) convicted the applicant of participation in a robbery and of being an accessory to the killing of a police officer and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment .

At around the same time his partner lost the care and custody of their children because of her heroin addiction and her incapacity to provide for their care . A childcare organisation was appointed guardian of the children . The oldest child was placed in the care of the applicant ’s mother . The youngest child was initially placed in a children ’s home and , at DATE , in a foster family . In prison the applicant had regular contacts with his children to the extent that this was possible . He also made arrangements with the childcare organisation in order to enable him to see the children after his release .

On DATE the applicant ’s residence permit was revoked and he was declared an undesirable alien ( ongewenste vreemdeling ) by the ORG Secretary of ORG ( ORG ) . The applicant ’s request for revision ( herziening ) of that decision was rejected on DATE by the ORG Secretary .

The applicant lodged an appeal against that decision with ORG of ORG ( Afdeling PERSON ) . He argued , inter alia , that his expulsion would constitute a breach of Article CARDINAL of the Convention since he would no longer be able to exercise his family life with his children .

The applicant further requested the President of ORG ( ORG ) in summary proceedings ( kort geding ) to issue an interim measure allowing him to await the outcome of the appeal proceedings before to ORG . This request was rejected by the President of ORG on DATE . The President , noting that financial difficulties had led the applicant to become involved in the facts of which he had been convicted and that he wished to maintain his relationship with his seriously heroin - addicted partner , held that recidivism could not be excluded .

On DATE the applicant was expelled to GPE . He travelled back to the GPE on CARDINAL DATE , allegedly because his mother and his children had difficulties living without him . He further made arrangements with the childcare organisation in order to see his youngest child .

On DATE , ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE . It held that the interference with the applicant ’s family life with his children was justified under the second paragraph of LAW , in particular on the ground of prevention of disorder . It found that neither the applicant ’s submissions about the interest of himself and his children in his continued stay in the GPE nor his personal circumstances should be given an overruling importance by the ORG Secretary .

On DATE , the applicant was convicted of unlawful residence in the GPE as an undesirable alien and sentenced to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . On DATE , he requested the ORG Secretary of ORG to revoke the decision declaring him an undesirable alien .
On DATE , the applicant was expelled to GPE and , on DATE , the ORG Secretary rejected his request of DATE .

After having returned for a second time to the GPE , the applicant was expelled to GPE on DATE . On DATE , the applicant was again convicted of unlawful residence in the GPE as an undesirable alien . He was sentenced to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment .
After having returned for a third time to the GPE , the applicant was expelled to GPE on DATE .

On DATE , the applicant filed a new request with the ORG Secretary of ORG to revoke the decision declaring him an undesirable alien . This request was rejected on DATE . On DATE , after having returned to the GPE for a fourth time , the applicant was expelled to GPE .

On DATE the applicant married a NORP national , Ms. PERSON , in GPE . In DATE , his spouse filed a request for a provisional residence visa ( machtiging tot voorlopig verblijf ) on behalf of the applicant for the purpose of “ stay with spouse ” . The PERSON local police issued a positive opinion on the condition that the applicant complied with the requirements for the stated purpose , one of these being no criminal record .

After the provisional residence visa had been issued in DATE , the applicant entered the GPE on DATE . On DATE , he applied for a residence permit ( vergunning tot verblijf ) and , for this purpose , signed a declaration in NORP stating that he had never had any dealings with the police or the criminal justice authorities ( antecedentenverklaring ) . On DATE , he was granted a residence permit .

On DATE the ORG Secretary withdrew the applicant ’s residence permit , holding that both the provisional residence visa and the residence permit had been issued erroneously , as DATE pursuant to LAW ( b ) and ( c ) of LAW persons having been declared an undesirable alien are not eligible for residence permits . In addition and , according to his own statement , hoping that this would remain unnoticed , he had signed a declaration that he had no criminal record .

The applicant ’s objection ( bezwaar ) to the decision was rejected by the ORG Secretary on DATE . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against that decision with ORG ( Arrondissementsrechtbank ) sitting in GPE . He also filed a request for an interim measure prohibiting his expulsion pending the appeal proceedings . On DATE , the President of ORG granted the interim measure on grounds of the ORG Secretary ’s failure to submit necessary documents in time .

On DATE , following a hearing held on DATE , ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal . It held that the applicant ’s residence permit to stay with a NORP spouse had been withdrawn on correct grounds , since DATE by signing the declaration on criminal antecedents – the applicant had provided incorrect information . Recalling that the applicant had stated that he had signed this declaration in the hope that it would not be noticed that he had had dealings with the GPE criminal justice system and that he had served a DATE prison sentence and thus would obtain a residence permit , ORG concluded that he had willingly misinformed the authorities .

Insofar as the applicant relied on LAW NORP spouse and his CARDINAL children , ORG considered , taking into account the applicant ’s conviction in balancing the interests involved as required under LAW , that the interests of the GPE authorities outweighed those of the applicant . ORG held that , after ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE , no new facts or circumstances had become apparent prompting a different finding .
On an unspecified date , the applicant returned or was expelled to GPE .
Under LAW ( Vreemdelingenwet ) , an alien can be declared undesirable by the Minister of Justice when he or she has been convicted of an offence punishable by a prison sentence of DATE or more .

Article CARDINAL of LAW ( GPE ) provides that an alien who stays in the GPE knowing that he has been declared an undesirable alien commits a criminal offence punishable by CARDINAL months’ imprisonment or a fine of MONEY .

According to LAW ACARDINAL/CARDINAL.CARDINAL of FAC ( Vreemdelingencirculaire ) , a body of immigration directives drawn up and published by ORG , a decision declaring a person an undesirable alien shall – upon a request thereto from the person concerned –be lifted after DATE residency abroad where the decision declaring this person an undesirable alien has been taken on grounds of a conviction of serious violent crimes or drug dealing . This period is DATE where the decision is based on a conviction for other crimes .
